abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Implementation Completion
            Report (ICR) for the Second Agricultural Development Project
            in the Arab Republic of Egypt. The project objectives were
            to: (i) promote increased agricultural productivity through
            introduction of appropriate farm technology, including farm
            machinery services, to farmers in the seven rice-growing
            governorates in the Nile Delta; (ii) assist in the
            modernization of the national seed industry; and (iii)
            improve the efficiency of the agriculture credit system. The
            Bank performed satisfactorily in project supervision.
            Although the Project experienced long implementation delays
            and required major restructuring, the overall assessment is
            that it was satisfactory in the achievement of its
            development objectives. The Project provides a number of
            important lessons: (a) Keep it Simple: Projects need to be
            kept simple, and in line with administrative capacity. (b)
            Parallelism Among Donors: In appraising and supervising
            development credit projects, attention needs to be paid to
            the competitiveness of the lending terms. (c) Understand the
            Risks. (d) Check the Regulations. (e) Implement Projects
            with Flexibility.
